title: Abhyankar–Moh theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Abhyankar–Moh theorem states that if L {\displaystyle L} is a complex line in the complex affine plane C 2 {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{2}} , then every embedding of L {\displaystyle L} into C 2 {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{2}} extends to an automorphism of the plane. It is named after Shreeram Shankar Abhyankar and Tzuong-Tsieng Moh, who published it in 1975. More generally, the same theorem applies to lines and planes over any algebraically closed field of characteristic zero, and to certain well-behaved subsets of higher-dimensional complex affine spaces.
